Episode 018 - A Voice First Future with Brian Roemmele
With the Thanksgiving holiday around the corner, I want to share a few thankful thoughts:
- I am thankful for my family and friends.
- I enjoy my work and my team.
- I am thankful for the connections I have made here on Linkedin and the support many of you have given me.
While I was waiting for my INTERVIEW in a reception area, a pizza delivery man, a young guy, dressed in a T-shirt and jeans carried a heavy pack of pizza boxes and water bottles.
He struggled with the door, I jumped up, but before I could help him, a receptionist let him through.
5 mins later I am sitting in the interview conference room, the pizza delivery man walks in.
He extends his hand for a handshake and says
"I am Greg Tagaris, Chief Information Officer of DoubleClick. Sorry I am a little late, I was taking food to my guys. They are working without lunch because we have technical problems.
I saw you trying to help me, thanks".
He offered me a job right at the end of the interview, and I accepted, without negotiation.
You can tell a good boss very quickly by how they treat other people. Greg was one of many good bosses I had a good fortune to work for.

My goals at Exactuals:1. Create a robust front-end and middle tier that is flexible, resilient, scalable, and fast.2. Serve the needs  of internal operations of the company. From facilitating the processing of payments, managing our platform users, to onboarding our clients. My goal is to to build tools that make that simple and easy.3. Grow and gain experience in leadership and enterprise software.4. Create new products with tried and true, yet innovative technologies and methods.How I am accomplishing my goals:Move all client assets to Cloudfront in a distributed decentralized manner(node, grunt, AWS, REDIS)I served as Scrum Master for the PaymentHub engineering team for the first year of our venture into Agile with Scrum.Design, architecture, and delivery of Internal Operations dashboard web application(AngularJS, node.js, MySQL, AWS, Redis).Design, architecture, and delivery of PaymentHub web application from the ground up(AngularJS, node.js), See consultant work on previous work experience. Successfully handed application off to PaymentHub team and front-end developers to add new features.Architecture and integration of AngularJS based extension system for PaymentHub(AngularJS) for rapid prototyping or single focus micro-applications outside of the SDLC.Work with design and front-end to implement new features into PaymentHub(AngularJS, Grunt, node.js, Jenkins, AWS).Created unified search API that takes advantage of advanced SQL capabilities. (node.js, Aurora/MYSQL, AWS) Incorporated Query Object architectural pattern with an ORM on the server side.Architectural planning and implementation of AWS Lambda logging streams for high volume data(Lambda, node.js, S3, datapipeline, redshift).Implement test driven development for front-end applications(Mocha, Protractor, Karma, Istanbul, Grunt)Architecture and design of dynamic analytics/dashboards system(angular, fractional, google charts)Proof of Concept & implementing of internal BI tools.
Software and web application prototype creation.Consultations on SDLC and application architecture.

Design architecture for PaymentHub web application. (Node, AngularJS, Grunt)Build out base application for PaymentHub web application. Created bootstrap version for new projects to be easily spooled up.Implement Unit tests for application with baseline 95% coverage(AngularJS, Karma)Implement Functional tests for application(AngularJS , Protractor)Introduce technology to development team and train front-end developers on best practices.I was offered a full time position shortly after starting this contract, but I was happy with the position I held at another company, so I held off until March of the following year, and then took a full time position as a partner at Exactuals.

Full stack Node.js/Angular architecture and engineering.Architect and engineer push notification queue system to scale using AWS's SNS service.Architect and engineer caching system for expensive api calls using Redis. Exponential performance improvement when blocking functions are involved.Architect and engineer Mongo change/migration management tool. Create interface in AngularJS.Architect and engineer version 1 of AngularJS based CRM.Architect internal tools in AngularJS. Rebuilt CMS functionality with web app functionality.Architect internal API and auth for internal tools. Architect and engineer MongoDB history for analytics using AWS RedShift.
Develop front-facing applications and website.Work with designers to create user interface.

I hope to work with him again in the future.

In the past year of working with Steve, I have watched him grow in his role and take initiative to make the changes necessary in order to ensure a viable product. His knowledge base is vast. His ability to implement the needed management techniques is impressive.Every time I would bring up an issue, he would already know the issue, and have a solution. If I would point out a potential deployment pattern, he was already aware of the pattern, along with the pros and cons.Steve is always available to talk, and ready to address concerns and then take action. I would be happy to work with him again.

summary: I have a passion for clean, efficient systems, and a drive to make things that work well for the end user. The idea of putting years of work into a product that doesn't even work properly, that is riddled with technical debt, disparate technologies, and overly complex systems, drives me absolutely crazy; yet this is the norm. The solution is actually pretty simple. Hiring the right person at the start of the business. The choice of a technical founder can make all the difference in the world. My background as a photographer, musician, mechanic, small business owner, and software architect, along with my experience in leadership starting from my early teens, gives me a very distinct perspective when it comes to what I bring to the table. I envision software systems in a unique way. I'm open to new technologies, but generally only when they have been proven as viable in the real world. I hold a belief in lean and agile methodologies, which has consistently lead me to the creation of working(sellable) software within a month of starting development.
